WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Hi,

We are closing this work item as the problem reported by the user was solved.

If further support regarding this topic is required, you can create a new thread in the discussions section, where we can help you with your concerns.

Thanks,

Damian Cherubini
http://blogs.southworks.net/dcherubini
WorkItem.Description:
Hi,

I use the Prism compilation for .NET 4.5 and got an error because the version of Microsoft.Practices.ServiceLocation.dll mismatch.

How can I solve this Problem... my solution is now not running in VS 2012. :-(

Comments.Message:
OK... I compiled the source for NET 4.5 but now no Event will going through.

I could need really help...

Hi,

It would be helpful if you could explain in further detail the problem you are describing related to the events and in what scenario you are having this problem.

Also, regarding the __Prism for .NET 4.5__ compilation, I believe you might find the following thread interesting where a user had a similar problem:* [Prism 4.5 and Unity 3.0 ](https://compositewpf.codeplex.com/discussions/443219)

Thanks,

Damian Cherubinihttp://blogs.southworks.net/dcherubini

Hi Damian,

ty for your answer... I thought I was alone. :-(

With .NET 4.0 my application works very well.If I use .NET 4.5 and a compile of Prism to this .NET Version no EventAggregator will work.And I got no error message.I use MEF and so your link isnt very useful for me...

Hi Damian,

ty for your answer... I thought I was alone. :-(

With .NET 4.0 my application works very well.If I use .NET 4.5 and a compile of Prism to this .NET Version no EventAggregator will work.And I got no error message.I use MEF and so your link isnt very useful for me...

Hi again,

We tried recompiling the __Prism__ library for __.NET 4.5__ using the latest version of the __Service Location__ library (taken from the [Service Location CodePlex site](https://commonservicelocator.codeplex.com/releases/view/17694) ) and we could use the __EventAggregator__ without problems.

It could be useful if you could list in detail the steps you are following to recompile the __Prism__ library.

Also, it could be useful if you could check your recompiled version of __Prism__ in a small spike application to ensure that the problem lies in the assemblies and not in your real application's configuration (for example, left-over references, etc.)

Regards,

Damian Cherubinihttp://blogs.southworks.net/dcherubini

Hi Damian,

I am confused... your link to the Service Lacation CodePlex side leads me to Microsoft.Practices.ServiceLocation.dll Version 1.0.0.0.But for my compile I use the newer Version 1.1.0.0.Was this wrong?

What did I do?- get the prism sources 4.1 and open them with VS 2012- Switch to .NET 4.5- Change the assembly Microsoft.Practices.ServiceLocation.dll to Version 1.1.0.0- Compile them --> no error- bind the new prism assemblies and Microsoft.Practices.ServiceLocation.dll Version 1.1.0.0 to my Project--> no Event works :-(
ups sorry... there is the newer Version too at this site.I use em...

I am too stupid to do this.If I build a Version with my compiled .NET 4.5 Prism I get a ReflectionTypeLoadException as my app want to load the  practices.prism 4.1.0.0.

HEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEELP :-(

Hi,

I have created a sample app using Prism libraries compiled for __.NET 4.5__ and using __Service Locator version 1.1.0.0__, and uploaded it to my __SkyDrive__ account.

#+ [Prism for .NET 4.5 and latest ServiceLocator sample app](https://skydrive.live.com/redir?resid=5A2B4B74A8FB9815!111)

You can also find the compiled libraries from Prism into the _lib_ folder so you can use them in your own application.

Regards,

Federico Martinez http://blogs.southworks.net/fmartinez

Hi Federico,

many thanx for your help.I will build my app with your compiled prism-dlls and try it...
